byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

abstract: Former Sen Phil Gramm is set to testify before House Financial Service Committee as part of examination of the Dodd-Frank regulatory overhaul; Gramm was one of chief architects of sweeping financial deregulation in the late 1990s, and has repeatedly criticized regulation imposed by five-year-old law.
lead_paragraph: Phil Gramm, one of the chief architects of a sweeping deregulation of financial rules in the late 1990s, will testify before the House Financial Services Committee on the impact of Dodd-Frank.

headline.main: Deregulator of Banks Set to Testify Before House
headline.print_headline: Deregulator of Banks Set to Testify Before House

snippet: Phil Gramm, one of the chief architects of a sweeping deregulation of financial rules in the late 1990s, will testify before the House Financial Services Committee on the impact of Dodd-Frank.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
